nodes.description: Wanganui Computer Centre于1976年开放，存储国家执法数据库
nodes.support_text: The Wanganui Computer Centre, opened in 1976, held the National Law Enforcement Data Base.

nodes.description: 民主自由主义者担忧计算机记录公民个人信息可能带来的危险
nodes.support_text: The computer's ability to record the personal information of citizens was seen as potentially dangerous by civil libertarians.

nodes.description: 1981年南非橄榄球赛期间，公众舆论因反对政府政策而极化
nodes.support_text: These concerns grew with the polarisation of public opinion during the Springbok rugby tour of 1981 and subsequent protests against the policies of the government of Prime Minister Robert Muldoon.

nodes.description: Neil Roberts作为长期参与抗议活动的22岁无政府主义者身份被提及
nodes.support_text: Neil Roberts, a 22-year-old anarchist who had long been involved in the protest movement

nodes.description: 1982年11月18日，Roberts在计算机中心进行炸弹袭击并自杀
nodes.support_text: Neil Roberts... blew himself up in a bomb attack on the computer centre.

nodes.description: 袭击被解释为反对政府权威的象征性行动
nodes.support_text: The action appears to have been as much a symbolic blow against what Roberts saw as an authoritarian state...

nodes.description: 照片展示了Wanganui计算机中心受到的损害
nodes.support_text: This photograph shows the damage sustained by the Wanganui Computer Centre

edges.support_text: The computer's ability to record the personal information of citizens was seen as potentially dangerous by civil libertarians.
These concerns grew with the polarisation of public opinion during the Springbok rugby tour of 1981 and subsequent protests...
Neil Roberts, a 22-year-old anarchist who had long been involved in the protest movement

炸弹袭击后，照片记录了计算机中心受损情况
